p: Solidago canadensis L. (Asteraceae), native to North America, has successfully invaded many areas worldwide. The success of invasion can be related to the plant's high phenotypic plasticity (Du et al., 2017). S. canadensis has a relatively wide niche with different soil properties in Europe (Szymura & Szymura, 2013) and can rapidly spread in non‚Äênative regions with different climatic conditions (Li, Du, Guan, Yu, & van Kleunen, 2016). Currently, S. canadensis has been naturalized in many areas and is considered one of the most destructive and widespread invasive species (Wang, Jiang, Zhou, & Wu, 2018), distributed in multiple areas, including farmland, the sides of roads, and upland forests.
